metadata.title: CVE-2024-33655 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
The DNS protocol in RFC 1035 and updates allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (resource consumption) by arranging for DNS queries to beaccumulated for seconds, such that responses are later sent in a pulsingburst (which can be considered traffic amplification in some cases), akathe "DNSBomb" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-33655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libunbound8 - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.5
python3-unbound - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.5
unbound - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.5
unbound-anchor - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.5
unbound-host - 1.13.1-1ubuntu5.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unbound package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-1ubuntu5.5').
